channel.title: Cannot connect?
channel.description:
Okay well... Once again, here I am in the help section again :(
Hopefully this will be my last question for a while!
Well I'm using a Deltascape source and some random client with ip changing availability. Well, I've portforwarded 43594 and I've change my no-ip domain. I've even tried connecting with just my ip...
Nothing works... So I use localhost to see if Its something that I edited or something, well, I connect easily with localhost. I log out, and I check the server log and I get this like [code]localhost:17490[/code]
From what I understand, the ip of a server works like this: 127.0.0.1:43594 / Ipaddress:port
So I THINK I changed the port correctly in "client.java" I compiled, and still to no avail... I can't connect...
Help would be appreciated, and I'm more than willing to allow remote access with teamviewer.
Thanks, ~Rosie

item.title: Cannot connect?
item.dc:creator: @Rosiered Rosiered
item.description:
@Rosiered wrote:

Okay well… Once again, here I am in the help section again

Hopefully this will be my last question for a while!

Well I’m using a Deltascape source and some random client with ip changing availability.
Well, I’ve portforwarded 43594 and I’ve change my no-ip domain. I’ve even tried connecting with just my ip…

Nothing works…
So I use localhost to see if Its something that I edited or something, well, I connect easily with localhost. I log out, and I check the server log
and I get this like

localhost:17490

From what I understand, the ip of a server works like this: 127.0.0.1:43594 / Ipaddress:port

So I THINK I changed the port correctly in “client.java” I compiled, and still to no avail… I can’t connect…

Help would be appreciated, and I’m more than willing to allow remote access with teamviewer.

Thanks,
~Rosie
